slides.title: Why Turn Research into Stories?

elements.content: Our tool transforms raw research into animated storyboards using Remotion.

slides.narration: We'll show you how our Storyboard tool uses artificial intelligence and Remotion to convert complex research into dynamic, engaging videos.
slides.directorNotes: Open with a fade-in on the heading for 3 seconds then wipe-in the paragraph. Use Remotion Composition to create the slide container; nest two Sequence components for the heading and paragraph. Set a calm background colour (e.g., pale blue) and a motivating melody at low volume. Cross-fade into the next slide.

slides.title: Stage A: Ingest – From Outline to Narrative
slides.narration: First we ingest your research. The tool reads outlines, bullet points and diagrams to build a clear narrative outline that frames the problem, insight, and solution.
slides.directorNotes: Use a Sequence for the bullet list; each bullet should animate upward with 0.5 second delay. Over a darkened background, emphasise the narrative outline concept. Trigger a soft whoosh SFX with each bullet to highlight the transition. Show an icon representing ingestion beside the title. Keep the pacing moderate; allow viewers to read each bullet before moving on.

slides.title: Stage B: Structuring – Scenes & Storyboard
slides.narration: Next, the story is structured into scenes. We declare the timing and order for every element, then emit human‑readable YAML and machine‑readable JSON storyboards.
slides.directorNotes: Nest a Sequence within the slide for each bullet point and time them evenly. Use icons for YAML and JSON next to the final bullet. Show sample YAML/JSON code snippets behind a semi-transparent overlay. Remind viewers of the default FPS and resolution. Maintain a subtle technological soundscape and cross‑fade into the next slide.

slides.title: Stage C: Production – Build with Remotion
slides.narration: During production, our tool builds your video using React and Remotion. We compose each slide as a composition and sequence, then layer in the voice‑over, music and transitions to bring the narrative alive.
slides.directorNotes: Split the slide into two parts: the bullet list appears first, followed by a code snippet that fades in. Use monospace font for the code and highlight the Composition and Sequence tags. While the code appears, play a subtle typing sound. Employ Remotion's Sequence components to time the bullet list and code snippet. Keep the background neutral, focusing attention on the content.

slides.title: Stage D: Render & Review
slides.narration: Finally we render your video and thumbnails, generate a contact sheet, and share it for review so you can iterate with your team quickly.
slides.directorNotes: Keep this slide brisk. Show icons for MP4 files and thumbnails while the bullets appear. Mention the Remotion CLI command `npx remotion render`. The contact sheet should be shown as a small grid. End with a quick push-left transition to the next slide.

slides.title: Master Prompt & Schemas

content: Define narrative arc: hook, tension, resolution

slides.narration: Our master prompt steers the AI to decide the narrative arc, break the story into slides with elements, timing and audio, and produce both YAML and JSON storyboards from a single prompt.
slides.directorNotes: Begin with a heading fade‑in to emphasise the master prompt concept. Then animate the bullets up sequentially. Illustrate a prompt box with placeholders like `<<<RESEARCH>>>`. Emphasise that YAML and JSON are isomorphic; perhaps add small icons representing each format. Use a thoughtful, minimal soundtrack. Provide enough time for viewers to grasp the concept before transitioning.

slides.title: Ready to Create Your Own Storyboard

elements.content: Harness the power of AI and Remotion to turn your research into engaging video narratives. Let's build your story together.

slides.narration: Now you're ready to transform research into dynamic videos. Let our tool handle the technical details while you focus on your story.
slides.directorNotes: Conclude with an uplifting tone. Scale the heading up for impact and fade in the paragraph afterwards. Keep the background bright and inspiring. Increase the music volume by 3 dB towards the end. Fade to black as the last words finish.
